metadata.name: The Divine Personified
metadata.description: More than a 1,000-year-old ritual and custom that has become tradition. Known by various names ‘Theyyam’, ‘Bhoota Kola’ and ‘Theyre,’ predominantly followed in Southern India. The vessels become a channel to God almighty himself and the art is believed to be extremely ancient. Noted by archaeologists, researchers, and historians, to contain traits originating as early as the Neolithic, and Chalcolithic periods. It is said that their gaze is so deep and piercing that there is nothing a person can hide from them. People seek their forgiveness, blessings, and advice; all are humbled in front of them.
